_header: Heaven it is a rich tower
_description: Strive to win Heaven — eight lines (abcbdbeb) or four monorhyming long lines

NLS1881.Transcription:
[H]Euen it es a richȝ tureWele bies im þat itte may
                    win[ne]Of mirthes ma þan ert may thinkAnd þa iois sal neuer
                    [ende]sinful man bot þu þe mendand forsake þin wikkid
                    sinþu mon singge haþ wailawayfor comes þu nevermare
                    þar I[n]
NLS1881.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 66.
Oliver,  Raymond. 
             Poems Without Names: The English Lyric 1200-1500.
         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 84.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 169.
